course_description: This course explores theories and histories of international development to provide students with the groundwork for the rest of the MDP. Through a review of different schools of development thinking, from modernization and dependency theories to political economy analyses, students learn how different people and groups have tackled both the questions of what development is and the contexts that have shaped those approaches.
schedule_location: W 3pm-6pm in Emerson Chemistry Bldg. E102
